title: 105_hr908
content:
The Commission on Structural Alternatives for the Federal Courts of Appeals is established to study and make recommendations on the division and structure of the Federal Court of Appeals system, focusing on the Ninth Circuit. The Commission will report its findings to the President and Congress for consideration. The Commission on Structural Alternatives for the Federal Courts of Appeals will consist of 10 members appointed by various officials within 60 days of the enactment of the Act. Vacancies will be filled in the same manner as the original appointment, and the Commission will elect a Chair and Vice Chair from among its members. The Commission on Structural Alternatives for the Federal Courts of Appeals will consist of 10 members appointed by various officials within 60 days of the enactment of the Act. The Commission shall elect a Chair and Vice Chair from among its members. Six members shall constitute a quorum, but three may conduct hearings. SEC. 3. COMPENSATION.

Members of the Commission who are officers or full-time employees of the United States will not receive additional compensation but will be reimbursed for necessary expenses. Private members will receive $200 per day for duties performed, plus expenses reimbursement. 

SEC. 4. PERSONNEL. The Commission may appoint an Executive Director who will receive compensation not exceeding the rate for level V of the Executive Schedule. The Executive Director can appoint additional personnel without following certain regulations, and their compensation should not exceed the annual maximum rate for a position above GS-15. The Executive Director of the Commission can hire experts and consultants at rates not exceeding the highest level of the General Schedule pay rates. The Administrative Office of the United States Courts will provide administrative and financial services to the Commission, while the Federal Judicial Center will offer research services on a reimbursable basis. The Commission can request information and assistance from government departments, agencies, and independent bodies. They must submit a report to the President and Congress within 18 months of appointing the sixth member, and terminate 90 days after submitting the report. Congressional committees must act on the report within 60 days of submission. SEC. 8. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. The Commission is authorized to receive up to $900,000 for the purposes of this Act. The funds appropriated will remain available until expended.
